					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Ultimate Guide To Social Media For ECommerce]]></title>
		<link>https://iamtechie.com/social-media-for-ecommerce/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 28 Aug 2020 12:10:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admins]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesinfotech.co.in/blog/?p=2512</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>INTRODUCTION</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The wonders which social media can do for a business, even a website or any tool can’t do! Name any objective, and social media will serve that for you. Generating leads, increasing traffic, ramping up brand awareness, database collection, etc., all can be done with social media platforms.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is just because social media platforms allow companies to interact directly with people, keep a note of their mood and then design the strategies accordingly. It is effortless to adopt new trends and draw out a plan for sales and marketing through social media</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Why is social media important for eCommerce</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>eCommerce is all about making more and more people aware of the products, exclusive features, brand new offers, and increasing brand image. Every social media site has its pros and cons. But it is the vast user database that makes it necessary to be active on every platform.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Thus, if you say that I will only advertise on Instagram and leave the rest, then you are surely committing a big mistake. So, let’s see in detail how every social media platform works and which strategies suit the best for eCommerce.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>How do you drive traffic from social media?</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The social media account should have a good number of followers which can be gained through engaging content and ads. After this, your accounts bio must be attractive, and there should be a link to your website. Make your content easy to share. There is a specific time when people are most active on social media platforms. For, e.g.:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Twitter - Thursday - 5 PM</li><li>Facebook - Thursday - 8 PM</li><li>LinkedIn - Wednesday - 9 AM</li><li>Instagram - Friday - 7PM</li><li>Pinterest - Friday - 1 AM</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And at last, focus more on visual content to drive traffic from social media. There are higher chances of visual content to get shared on social media than just simple text content.&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://techiesinfotech.com.au/services/social-media-marketing.html">Facebook marketing for eCommerce</a></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>With 2.32 billion users at the end of 2018, Facebook is still one of the best places to generate leads for eCommerce business. Though the shine of the platform has decreased in the past few years due to the introduction of Instagram, even the latter is also dependent on it! For setting up a business account on Instagram, you must set up a page on Facebook too!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Facebook Ads: There are 13 types of ads. These are as follows:</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Image Ads</strong> -Add the images of the product along with their link</li><li><strong>Video Ads</strong> -Video ads can run in News Feed and Stories, or they can appear as in-stream ads in longer Facebook videos.</li><li><strong>Video Poll Ads</strong> -Make the standard ads more interactive by embedding the option of polling.</li><li><strong>Carousel Ads </strong>-A carousel ad uses up to 10 images or videos to showcase your product or service. You can use this format to highlight different benefits of one product, several different products, or even use all the photos together to create one large panorama image</li><li><strong>Slideshow Ads</strong> -One can create short video ads from a collection of still photos, text, or existing video clips.</li><li><strong>Collection Ads</strong> -These allow to showcase multiple products at one time.</li><li><strong>Instant Experience Ads</strong> -&nbsp;Full-screen ad format that loads 15 times faster than a mobile website outside of Facebook.</li><li><strong>Lead Ads</strong> -Without filling up the details on your own, the form will collect the details automatically and help you move forward to the next task.</li><li><strong>Dynamic Ads</strong> -This is by far the best option to bring back the customer and help him regain the interest in the product if he had left the purchase last time on the website. The product will appear in their Facebook feed.</li><li><strong>Messenger Ads</strong> -By adding CTA, you can allow the customers to talk with your salespeople through the Facebook messenger.</li><li><strong>Stories Ads</strong> -Majority of the people make purchases through stories. The best part about them is that the video is played on full screen. Viewers don’t have to rotate their screens for this.</li><li><strong>Stories Augmented Reality Ads</strong> -It allows users to use features like filters and animations for better interaction with the audience.</li><li><strong>Playable Ads</strong> -Interact with the audience by creating a game.</li><li><strong>Instagram marketing for eCommerce</strong> -Instagram is the most dynamic platform where you can easily interact with your customers, network with people, increase your sales and brand awareness exponentially.</li><li><strong>Post a variety of content </strong>-&nbsp;Content is the most crucial instrument of engaging the followers. This is what will differentiate your company from your competitors. Regular stories and posts is what followers want. It is your responsibility for how impressive your campaign is. Posting product photos, videos, posting offers, giving takeaways, or online competitions are some of the tasks that every major ecommerce company does!</li><li><strong>Using Instagram ads</strong> -&nbsp;After seeing your posts and stories, people might want to place an order. Through instagram ads, you can include the link of the product and direct the customers directly to the website. Instagram ads are a perfect tool to generate leads.</li><li><strong>Use Hashtags</strong> -Hashtags play a vital role to increase the reach of the instagram posts. They are also used to create campaigns. You can launch your attacks with fancy hashtags.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>LinkedIn marketing for eCommerce</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>LinkedIn is a professional platform where you can grow your network by connecting with the most influential people. You can advertise your business, pitch your business plan, and at the same time, learn a lot! It can also be used for hiring the best brains for your venture. Let’s see how we can <strong>generate more sales using LinkedIn.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There are five different ways of advertising through LinkedIn. These are as follows:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Text Ads</strong> :&nbsp;Using the phenomena of PPC, you can create your ads and manage them through Ads Manager.</li><li><strong>Sponsored Ads</strong> :&nbsp;It allows you to market on LinkedIn Homepage in the feeds section. Using this option, you can engage actively with the audience. Through proper images and engaging content, you can generate leads efficiently.</li><li><strong>Display Ads</strong> :&nbsp;It is the process of buying the Ad space through an open or private auction. These ads are displayed on the high traffic pages</li><li><strong>Dynamic Ads</strong> :&nbsp;It is the best option to create highly personalised Ad campaigns to communicate with the target audience. You must include eye-catching images and CTA.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Live streaming videos</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is one of the latest trends, followed by big ecommerce companies. It involves live video streaming of products by social media influencers. During the live stream, companies sometimes give offers/discounts to scale up sales.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Social media platforms are now coming with a feature to browse, shop and pay for the products you see through an ad, without leaving the app.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Remarketing</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It is the process of bringing back the visitor who once visited your website or a particular product. It is more crucial in the ecommerce industry. Major eCommerce companies create cookies on your computer, which record your activities on the website. After that, those targeted ads will follow the visitor everywhere. Some of the best remarketing strategies are:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Use copy to combat sales objections</strong>&nbsp;Rather than posting the same logos or posters which are already present on your website, post something about the common objections and doubts of people. For example, HubSpot posted on “CRM strategies that can save 124 hours per year” rather than other basic ads. Try to address the common doubts of your customers!</li><li><strong>Showcase products you know they are interested</strong> in&nbsp;Through ads, show customers only those products they have scrolled last time on your website with some offers like “25% discount”, “Free home delivery” etc.</li><li><strong>Show Complementary Products to Cross-Sell to Existing Customers</strong>&nbsp;Just because a prospect converts, doesn’t mean the party’s over. Instead of simply excluding these groups from your remarketing efforts, try targeting them with different sets of ads to sell them products to complement their original purchase.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Influencer marketing</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is what companies have experimented and have driven a lot of sales. A lot of people believe and follow the influencers whether instagram influencers, YouTubers, movie stars etc. These “die-hard” followers will surely buy the products sold by the influencers in the advertisement video. It leads to an increase in the number of followers too! You can do the influencer marketing in the following ways:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Sponsored Content</strong>&nbsp;Select any famous YouTuber or other social media channel’s famous profile. You can request them to get your brand featured like in a video or yourself create content with them!</li><li><strong>Guest Posting&nbsp;</strong>You can make creative content for an influencer’s social channel.</li><li><strong>Giveaways</strong>&nbsp;Run a contest and request the influencer to share your giveaway event with his followers. People trust people more than they trust brands. Influencer marketing allows you to leverage that trust to establish goodwill towards your brand.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Which social media platform to choose?</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Facebook : Ideal for targeted advertising for your products.</li><li>Twitter : Best for amusing content, conversations, or social support</li><li>Pinterest : Perfect for food, beauty, and fashion brands</li><li>Instagram : Best for brands with attractive physical goods</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Make sure your social media efforts are working</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>With poor social media strategy, even running ads won’t generate leads. Consistency and engaging content are the only essential components of&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://techiesinfotech.com.au/services/social-media-marketing.html">social media marketing.</a></strong><br>Keep a close eye on the analytics. With every campaign launched, make a detailed report like the number of sales done, followers increased, reach etc. Then figure out which platform is bringing the best conversion rate for you! Follow the trends and act accordingly.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Conclusion</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Social media is not so complicated but requires more uniqueness, creativity and cleverness. You need to know the trends in the market and the mood of your audience. Try to interact with your followers and solve their doubts, if any.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Just spending a lot of money on social media ads and buying premium tools will not generate leads as per your expectations. You need to have a perfect strategy with an aim to be achieved. This guide can solve all your problems related to social media.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Social media strategy in eCommerce can help you build your audience and expand your brand. Read this blog to know the ultimate guide to social media for eCommerce]]></excerpt:encoded>

Нет причины бросать свой автомобиль возле клуба или ресторана, если немного выпили.
Зачем после бурной ночи, затем утром возвращаться за машиной?

			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[191.102.164.104]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2022-12-25 22:11:20]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-25 22:11:20]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Facebook: <a href="https://www.baloanevesele.ro/categorie-produs/arcada-baloane/" rel="nofollow ugc">arcada baloane</a> cu heliu si decoratiuni cu baloane Bucuresti 
Pentru mmai multe detalii, accesati pagina noastra 
web: , telefon: . Şi Da, bǎrbaţii puternici unt 
mult mai sensibili decât îţi imaginezi. An de an intampini aceeasi problema, cel mai probabil, mai ales daca 
iti amintesti doar cu cateva zile inainte si 
nu esti foarte bun la gasit idei de cadouri pentru o zi de nastere.
Chiar si un darr modest si simbolic are uun efect pe masura, dar mai ales daca eeste sub forma unei 
surprize cu cadouri la domiciliu. Baloanele din latex de dimensiune micha 
au timp de plutire cateva ore, in timp ce baloanele de folie de dimensiuyni mari pot sa pluteasca o saptamana sau chiar mai mult.
Mai târziu au o petrecere de ziua în care mănâncă de obicei tocană și 
orez și un fel de mâncare cunoscut sub numele dde 
"kelewele", care este bucăți de pătlagină prăjite.
Notează The World Book Encyclopedia," considera că sărbătoarea nașterii cuiva este un obicei păgân ".
Individul celebru va face de obicei o dorință tăcută și va încerca să sufle lumânările dintr-o singură respirație; dacă are succes, 
o tradiție susține că dorința va fi îndeplinită.
În multe culturi, dorința trebuie păstrată secretă 
sau nu se va „împlini".]]></wp:comment_content>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[O emϳotie atat de sacra si suprareɑlista, dar ɑtat

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Ultimate Guide To Taking And Optimizing ECommerce Product Images]]></title>
		<link>https://iamtechie.com/ultimate-guide-for-optimize-e-commerce-images/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 28 Aug 2020 12:36:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admins]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesinfotech.co.in/blog/?p=2517</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>What attracts customers the most? Content or Pictures? Visual things like pictures and <strong><a href="https://techiesinfotech.co.in/services/video-production.html">videos increase sales.</a></strong> While content can provide the details of the product, customers will undoubtedly require to have a sight of the product which will force him to click on the "Order Now" button. When we say SEO, people start thinking about content, backlinks, keywords etc. but have you ever cared about image optimization?<br><br>Optimized images will boost organic searches and generate much better traffic sources as compared to content. So, let's discuss image optimization and tricks to optimize product images for eCommerce.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>What is image optimization (for SEO) ?</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Image optimization includes the following task:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Choosing the right image format</li><li>Selecting the correct level of compression</li><li>Replacing animated GIFs with video for faster page loads</li><li>Serving responsive images</li><li>Serving images with exact dimensions</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Capture Quality Product Photography</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Can I upload low-quality images? No! If you think that just a picture is necessary, then it's wrong. A high-quality image must be uploaded for any product. If it is blurry, small, unattractive will not motivate the visitors to click on the product link. Websites with top-notch pictures get more backlinks and earn&nbsp;<strong>higher rates of conversion.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Using a smartphone is allowed.</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Even if you do not have a professional camera, you can still click high-quality pictures from your smartphone. Nowadays, smartphones come with an influential 13 MP or even 48-MP camera. So, you can easily click the product images and optimize them. It can save you a lot of money as well!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Using a tripod for shooting</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It is complicated to shoot videos or take still pictures with a camera or smartphone in your hand. So, it is better that you buy a tripod for getting top-notch pictures. If you want to record product review videos, a tripod will help you shoot videos quickly!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Artificial Light Vs Natural Light</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you want to showcase the surroundings of the product rather than it's own intricacies, you must shoot the pictures in natural sunlight. Even if the product to be used is outside, then also prefer natural sunlight.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Artificial lighting can be done using bulbs, candles or even fire. E.g., if you want to take pictures of the makeup session, then you might require a closeup of the eyebrows along with makeup products.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Product Background</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Choose between white background or a real-world dynamic background. If you can't find a white background, bring a big bendable paper sheet which will be invisible on camera. This will help to showcase the critical details of the product, and visitors will also concentrate more on the product.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If the product is to be modelled by a person, then choose the dynamic backgrounds. Using the portrait mode, you can emphasize better on the product. Portrait mode will blur the product background such that the product context is apparent but doesn't compete with the product.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Enhance Photos with Photo Editor</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>One single picture equals a thousand online sales. But you should waste your whole day waiting for a perfect click. Just choose the best and through photo editing softwares, improve it! Photo editing is quite crucial because every product picture going on the web must be original, attractive and optimized.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Flaw removal</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The photo clicked by you is almost perfect, but some minor defects make it imperfect. Many photo editing tools can remove those defects and enhance the picture better. If you don't know how to edit, you can easily watch tutorials on the internet.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Utilizing effects and colours to the best advantage</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You can pop off colour. A pop of colour is a bright splash of colour that stands out against the other colours in a scene. Including a pop of colour in your image will have a powerful impact because it creates a strong focal point that instantly catches the eye. Using dominant colour (red, yellow and orange) and receding colour (blue, green and purple) combinations, you can create visual depth.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Remove the background</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You must remove the background so that you can place any other product or material for promotion. It is also done if the background in the actual picture doesn't look appealing!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Keep image size and style consistent</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Just like in any task of life, product images require consistency. One can&nbsp;<strong>quickly boost the sales,</strong>&nbsp;ramp up brand image, and provide better shopping experience if there is consistency. The creative designs decided for product images must be used all across the pictures.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Background</strong>&nbsp;If you chose to use a white or dynamic background, mannequin or model, flash or zero flashes, you have to be consistent across the board</li><li><strong>Size and shape</strong>&nbsp;You might have observed product images of different sizes on ecommerce websites that eventually don't look cool. So, if you are comparing two products or even uploading two different pictures of the same product, they should be of the same size. It should not be that one image looks bigger and other smaller.</li><li><strong>Developing consistency guidelines&nbsp;</strong>Background, size, colour palettes, lighting, props, product distance from the background, camera distance from the background are some of the factors that must be consistent all across the images. This will prevent you from taking re-shoots and instil a sense of belief in the customers</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>How to optimize product images on Search Engines - Image SEO</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Just like you stuff keywords in the content or blogs for <a href="https://techiesinfotech.co.in/services/digital-marketing-solution.html"><strong>SEO Services</strong></a><strong><a href="https://techiesinfotech.co.in/services/digital-marketing-solution.html">,</a> </strong>images must also have an appropriate filename. You can include the keywords in the picture's description. Apart from this, you can also use the Alt tag to your image that can describe the image and present it to the readers. Alt tags are the best way to make sure that the image always pops up in the search engine results.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You must include the captions and image titles too! They are used to give context to the image and give a proper message to the audience. Make sure that images are either in PNG, JPEG, or GIF file. The file type is also an essential aspect because it affects the loading time of a page. Loading time, in turn, is vital for SEO, whether for mobile or desktop. JPEG is still considered to be the best as it compresses the image efficiently with little quality reduction while GIFs are suitable for moving images. PNGs must be used when it includes some text and line drawings.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Conclusion</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Thus, we have observed how image optimization can affect your sales. Just uploading random images won't fetch you anything. It does not include clicking high-quality photos but also editing them properly, which can grab the attention of the visitors. Giving proper title and description to the image is also essential, You can include the trending keywords in the description so that it is instantly seen in the google search.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Techies Infotech </strong>graphics studio offers a variety of services. Our toolbox includes several tools for <strong><a href="https://techiesinfotech.co.in/services/creative-designing.html">creative designing </a></strong>that is appealing and user-centric. We provide packaging design, logo design, leaflet design, brochure design, prepress services, video design, illustration, vector conversion, copywriting, infographic design, magazine design, book cover design, print ad design, poster design, animation design, and photo retouching.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We also provide <strong>SEO services </strong>under which we generate organic leads, image optimization, increasing brand visibility, quantitative analyzing, and increasing traffic, sales, and ROI. We do website auditing, competition analysis, create SERP reports, On-page, and off-page optimization, etc.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[How To Optimize For Feature Snippets ?]]></title>
		<link>https://iamtechie.com/how-to-optimize-for-feature-snippets/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 28 Aug 2020 13:25:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admins]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesinfotech.co.in/blog/?p=2524</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>What are featured snippets?</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Snippets are used to display the summary of a web page, which is ultimately shown at the top of a SERP. It typically includes an image, source page title, and source page URL. It is shown at the "position zero" - below the ads and above the search results. They instantly grab the attention of the viewers and therefore help in increasing the website traffic. The reports say that there is a 10% increase in website traffic and a 6% surge in click-through rates.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Types of Featured Snippets</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Paragraph featured snippets</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>82% of the snippets fall under this category, and for this, Google uses text from the source page to answer the queries of people immediately. The website might have detailed information about the question being asked, but the snippet will use a portion of it and respond quickly. Paragraph snippets are best for the following types of questions:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Comparisons (X vs Y)</li><li>Who is…….</li><li>What is …..</li><li>Why is…….</li><li>How is …….</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Since it will be a short answer, it should be between 40-50 words. For better optimization, include the question as a heading and answer it directly.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>List featured snippets - Bulleted and Numbered Featured Snippets</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It is usually implemented in two ways: numbers and bullets. If you want to explain the process of something like recipes and DIY, then numbered featured snippets are used. If the content has something in which the order doesn't matter, you can use bulleted featured snippets.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If the list is quite long and doesn't fit into the snippet, then an option "More Items" will be added at the bottom. This option is quite helpful as it will indicate to the viewer that there is much to read, and thus click-through-rate increases. The optimization process includes the same process, i.e., including the heading and answering the questions in 40-50 words.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Table featured snippets</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you want to show collections of data, you can show it in the form of a table. Though Google will do it automatically for you, you should make the table yourself. This will help Google to find the data easily.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Video featured snippets</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Google has been placing a relevant video for "How to" searches to best answer the question. Google allows 90-seconds clip suggestions in the blue bar in the image above. You must organize the content in a step-by-step format and upload the script for the video's closed captions. In the description of the video, try to include long-tail keywords.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>The carousel snippet</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Through Carousel featured snippets, Google will automatically suggest the keywords related to your website niche and topics which a user might be searching. It appears in the form of a bubble at the top of the snippet. Clicking any one of those bubbles will display the featured snippet. If your articles have deeply answered any question in an ordered way, there are high chances that your content will be featured under the carousel snippet.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>The double featured snippet</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Two instead of one! - Yes, you heard it right! Google will display two featured snippets instead of one. It happens when one single featured snippet is not able to satisfy the viewer who is searching for a particular query. Thus, you have the double chance of being featured.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>The two-for-one featured snippet</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Sometime Google will combine the content from multiple websites to answer a query. The image also will be from some other source</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Optimization techniques</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Starting with proper old keyword research</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Studies suggest that most of the featured snippets contain long-tail keywords. The more the number of words typed into the search box, the more the probability of a featured snippet. It's always good to include the keywords while answering the questions as well! While performing the keyword research for the featured pieces, always start the question type with "what," "why," "how," etc.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Browse Google for more questions</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you head towards Google's own "People also ask" section, you will get a hint on what type of questions people generally ask. So, you can make the snippets for them too!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Aim at answering questions concisely.</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Google has started paying attention to long-form content, divided further into logical subsections using eye-grabbing images. Writing long articles will help you answer multiple questions. The only requirement would be to include questions as subheadings in the article. This will surely help in higher retention as snippets make the content structured and easier to read.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Be factual and organize well.</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The algorithm followed by Google to rank the pages considers the numbers, steps, and lists the most. If your content is unorganized, there are high chances that you won't get the desired results. Getting more factual in the blogs, mainly in the introduction paragraph, can prove to be quite helpful.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Comparison charts and lists are the easiest way of getting featured on Google as it's the best example of structured content. To answer a query, Google would prefer to pick up a table from another source rather than the same information provided in the paragraph form.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Use eye-catching images</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Paragraph featured snippets combined with high-quality and eye-grabbing images is the best combination. If there are no images in your blog, Google will pick up any other image from the web. So try to annotate the pictures well and use a good number of pictures in your blog. It would help if you also considered updating and re-uploading the photos as well.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Add the Q&amp;A page to your website.</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you are offering any product or service, the Q&amp;A page is the best option for featured snippets. While creating the Q&amp;A page, try to include more facts and figures. Give answers in short paragraphs, and keep it straightforward.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Tools used by us to find featured snippet opportunities</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>SEMRush</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>SEMRush can easily track and monitor featured snippets and provides tips to well-position the content on-page. Through analytics, you can well know which featured snippets are getting more clicks, and you can further optimize them. You can also find the featured snippets of your competitors and make the changes in your content accordingly.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Answer The Public</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is a free tool that will help you find the questions being asked by the people related to your favorite topic. Using this tool, you can include those questions in your blogs and Q&amp;A page.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Ahrefs</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This tool has special features for ranking the snippets. Under the SERP features, you will find the option of “featured snippets” under which you can perform various actions. It has a rank tracker along with the option of adding new keywords. You can also have a look on the featured snippets of your competitors and find out which keywords have been used!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Conclusion</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Featured snippets have become an integral part of the SEO strategy. Using structured content and eye-catching images is the only way of getting featured on Google. The tools will help you find the structure followed by your competitors. Through analytics, you can optimize your blogs. Adding the Q&amp;A page is the easiest way to get featured snippets.<br><br>Techies Infotech has been providing the best SEO and digital marketing services. We use the most trending tools for optimizing featured snippets. Our content writing team makes sure that the blogs are well structured and get the most clicks by stuffing the keywords in the content. Contact us immediately, and we will provide the best SEO services to you!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[5 Ways To Use LinkedIn Live To Build Brands - Techies Infotech]]></title>
		<link>https://iamtechie.com/5-ways-to-use-linkedin-live-to-build-brands/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 Sep 2020 10:36:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admins]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesinfotech.co.in/blog/?p=2537</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>5 Ways to use LinkedIn live to build brand</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After Facebook and Instagram launched their live streaming features, it was time for LinkedIn, the most professional platform, to enter the same business but with some unique features! A platform with 675 million monthly users and 30 million companies, LinkedIn live helped people reach out to a bigger audience and market their product.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It's just been a year that this feature has been launched, and experts say that they have witnessed seven times more reactions and 24 times more comments than standard videos.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>LinkedIn has introduced several features to generate more leads. So, let's dive deep into the working of LinkedIn live and make a strong strategy for using it!&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>What is LinkedIn Live?</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>LinkedIn live is the live streaming option given by LinkedIn through which users can create content using third-party tools also! It is similar to other platforms like Facebook and Instagram, where your content is visible to your audience, and you can interact with them directly</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>How to create a LinkedIn Live Stream</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Before going live on LinkedIn, you need the approval, which can be obtained by filling an online form. After it gets approved, you will get an email that will automatically direct you to the streaming platforms you can use. You can choose the best one that suits you and then further sign up for the account. After setting this, you have to connect it with your LinkedIn account.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Now, log in to the streaming tool that you have selected and start your live video. It's better to prepare a script before you start interacting with your audience.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Choosing a broadcaster tool</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Some of the most popular broadcasting tools include Socialive, Switcher Studio, and Restream. Other tools are Wirecast, Easylive, Teradek Care, Vimeo Live, Brandlive, Live U Solo, and Switcher.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Integrating the broadcaster tool</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The next after choosing the broadcaster tool is to integrate it with your account. There is also an option of beta testing, which might be free or paid depending on the tools.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After this, you are all ready to go live!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Top 5 Ways to Use LinkedIn Live</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Answer Questions</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The central aspect of going live on social media platforms is to interact with the audience and clear their doubts, which is impossible in usual video posts. If you are getting a lot of questions in the reviews section of your website or the emails or on social media, the best way to answer them is to host a live stream.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Showcase special events</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Whenever you want to attend any special event or host one, LinkedIn live is the perfect way to share the experiences with the followers. You can share your views on a topic, hold a private session with the panelists, and stream it live!&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Introduce team members</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Sometimes, the audience wants to specifically ask questions to a particular team member like the marketing head or technical head, etc. A better way would be to introduce your team and show off your employees through introductions, where each person shares some fun and interesting facts.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Discuss industry issues</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>LinkedIn is the best place to establish yourself as an expert on a particular subject and discuss the problems being faced. You can organize webinars where you discuss the problems and suggestions. You can also show the audience how your company or product will solve all those problems that you discussed in the webinar</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Share tips and tutorials</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>These are some of the video formats because they have a specific goal: enlighten the audience. Such live videos can capture more B2B audience.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Best practices for LinkedIn Live</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>General</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Consider series-based content</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you plan to go live every week or every month at a specific time, it will teach your audience to tune into your page at a particular time. You can decide on a series-based content, i.e., holding live sessions on a particular topic having the same theme for a week or month! For, e.g., the tech-related pages can organize webinar series on recent developments in AI and Machine learning and, through the same, attract their audience!&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Refrain from going live more than once a day</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It would be best if you didn't go live more than two times a day because every time you go live, a push notification will be sent to your followers. So, sending the notifications, again and again, will disturb them.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Avoid pre-recorded videos</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you think you can fool your audience by uploading a pre-recorded video rather than going live, it will surely have a reverse effect. It will reduce trust among the viewers. Live stream means that your viewers want to interact with you and ask some questions immediately.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Before the stream</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Test Your internet connection</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The preferred speed for an uninterrupted live stream should be 10 Mbps.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Get the right people in the room</strong>.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Rather than accommodating a group of people, try to have only 2-3 people in the room, one for holding the camera and the other two for having the conversation.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Plan to stream for at least 15 minutes</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Give your followers some time to join the stream. Don't keep a small stream, instead wait for them even if it goes beyond 15 minutes.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Analyze your audience</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After the stream is over, it is time to analyze the statistics. Through the numbers, find out from where the maximum number of followers are coming. Test different days of the week and time, and after some time, you will get a perfect combination to go live.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Promote your stream</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Advertise about your live stream on all the platforms. Make a poster and post it on all social media platforms and even send it via emails. You can also post it on the blog. In this way, you will get more viewers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Hashtag your stream</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The LinkedIn marketing revolves around hashtags. So, make sure that you include relevant hashtags in your posts and stream description.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>During the stream</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Moderate your stream</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The best way to moderate a stream on LinkedIn is to have a colleague with Page Admin access pull up your Page on a separate, desktop device and manage the flow of comments from the Page Admin view. Make sure to refresh the webpage from time to time to get the most recent comments. The moderator can then delete or report inappropriate comments and relay any questions.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Engage your audience</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You should organize Q&amp;A sessions to engage more audiences. The moderator should do this. Keep on having a conversation during the live video.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Take advantage of your network</strong>.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Ask your employees to share the live stream once it has begun. So, in this way you can take advantage of the network of all your employees</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>After the Stream</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Repurpose your live stream</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You can download the live stream and then share it on other social media platforms. You can also make short clips from the whole video and turn it into multiple posts.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Conclusion&nbsp;</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>LinkedIn is such a platform that can boost your sales and improve brand image much better than other platforms only if your strategies are set right. LinkedIn live is one such option that can tap a bigger audience, and through analytics, you can further make the changes.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We, at Techies Infotech, have been helping our clients in improving their brand image through LinkedIn live. Our creative team helps them set up everything, including the camera, making videos, posters, scripts, etc.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The social media team will take care of online marketing and advertise the live stream everywhere, including email marketing. Contact us immediately, and we will get all the things done for you!&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>

							</wp:comment>
					</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[How SEO Helped Businesses Survive COVID-19 - Techies Infotech]]></title>
		<link>https://iamtechie.com/how-seo-helped-businesses-survive-covid-19-techies-infotech/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 Sep 2020 11:03:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admins]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesinfotech.co.in/blog/?p=2541</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How SEO helped businesses survive COVID-19</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The novel coronavirus caged humankind into their rooms and brought the businesses online. All those running a business either through small shops or big showrooms who had never thought of setting up an online store were forced to do this to earn a living. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And you know that competition on the web is slightly different than offline. Bringing people to the website and catching their attention towards your product is quite tricky. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>But the most critical aspect of the pandemic is that people started spending double the time on the internet as compared to pre-COVID times. So, when the whole world is hooked up to the social media sites, generating leads and growing business is the need of the hour. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In this blog, we will discuss how SEO, which is the most significant aspect of digital marketing, helped companies revive. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>How COVID-19 has changed customer behavior</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If demonetization forced people to go cashless, COVID-19 prepared people to buy online from shops; every business also had to come online. This is evident from the fact that there has been a 10% growth in online shopping during the pandemic globally. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Due to cut in incomes, the majority of people are spending more on essential commodities like grocery and household supplies. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Another major shift has been seen in the entertainment and education sector. Institutions had to come online on the web to conduct online classes and conduct exams. This will accelerate more in the coming months. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>e-Commerce was already on the rise, but digital and contactless services like home delivery and drive-through services also saw much higher adoption rates. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Some statistics related to SEO during COVID-19</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>SEO has been helping businesses revive from huge losses during COVID-19. 63% of the companies confirmed that their SEO budgets were redistributed. However, 65% of the marketers anticipate a decrease in their annual marketing budget, but have allocated SEO the most out of it. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There has been a 10% surge in search ad impressions, 23% in search ad conversions, and 20% in search ad conversion rate. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The CPCs are falling but an increase in CTRs and CVRs. The automobile, entertainment, and education industry have increased their SEO budget by 12% during the pandemic.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>SEO is a low-cost, high-ROI strategy</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It is a fact that companies spend thousands of dollars on running social media ads and further hire specialists for them. But due to the pandemic, the revenue of almost all the companies has declined exponentially, and therefore hardly could anyone afford to pay for the Ads. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is quite visible because the FAANG companies (Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix, and Google) decreased their budget for online advertisements. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is the time when SEO comes for the rescue. This is the only technique that requires very little investment and has a high ROI if the strategies are implemented in the right way. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>SEO involves the cost of buying the tools (if any) and then bidding for the keywords. It is also observed that CPC (Cost per Click) for many words came down during the lockdown. So, all in all, it is a win-win situation and still helping the businesses to recover. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>The surge in local searches</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Almost all the countries imposed lockdown and people were advised to buy the food essentials and other essential things in bulk in advance so that they don’t have to go again and again. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This forced people to buy from the local and nearby shops rather than going to malls. Meanwhile, the local shops also started home delivery services, and this was the opportunity for them to scale their business by coming on the web. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The local shops with some initial investment launched their website and started taking orders online. Using the reports generated by Google Analytics, which suggested that people searched more about sanitizers, masks, PPE Kits, COVID-19 medicines, shops nearby, etc., the local grocery shops started selling these things and therefore revived their business. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>They used the same keywords in their product descriptions, title tags, blogs, URLs (the basic technique of on-page SEO), and got the results. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>SEO enhances the user experience</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A strategized on-page and off-page SEO leads to a better website structure, increased site speed, alluring design, catchy CTAs, compressed images, and enhanced customer experience. If you follow the best SEO practices, you will get a smooth website with quality content that generates leads and ranks at the top of SERPs. When implementing SEO, you look after all the aspects of the site, its design, internal links, content, CTAs, structure, image tags, URLs, etc. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>All these factors rank your website at the top and turn your company into a brand. It also makes it easier to do social marketing then! </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Getting ready post-pandemic</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The COVID-19 pandemic gave a strong message that you must bring your business on the web and follow the trends, so if in future such things happen, you are ready to face it! SEO has become a part of risk management. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>All those businesses focusing more on SEO today and striving hard to rank their websites will get better results post-pandemic. You can surely surpass your competitor and capture a more significant portion of the market. Utilize the online presence of people on the web, and later people won’t miss out on the updates from you! </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If email marketing is done right, then your audience will surely wait for your newsletters. If social media marketing is done right, then people will wait for your posts. Therefore, SEO has become a seed for the future. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Analytical Insights into demand</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The best thing while implementing SEO is using the analytical tools, and you can easily measure everything, i.e., the effect of every step in the form of numbers and graphs. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Tools like Google Analytics, Google Keywords Planner, SEMrush, etc. deliver detailed reports. Using metrics like CTRs, CPCs, website traffic, A/B testing can help you change your strategies accordingly.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Conclusion</strong> </h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We can conclude by saying that SEO is the biggest savior for the businesses during the pandemic and post it also! Without SEO, running Ads and spending thousands of dollars will not reap anything. It must be mentioned that though many automation tools are available that make it easy for you to do SEO, it still requires an experienced team.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Techies Infotech has the best digital marketing team in India. Our team is quite proficient in On-page and off-page SEO, implementing the strategies for website, social media, and email marketing. We use the best trending tools and provide detailed reports to our clients. Want your site at the top? Call us, and we will do it for you. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Technical Guide To Magento SEO Issues]]></title>
		<link>https://iamtechie.com/technical-guide-to-magento-seo-issues/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 29 Sep 2020 07:18:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admins]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesinfotech.co.in/blog/?p=2563</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Magento is the ever evolving platform that helps businesses boost their sales and bring advancements in the user experience. However, out of the box, Magento is a complex platform when it comes to SEO.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, many of the SEO issues are simple to resolve, but many turn out to be strenuous and require an in-depth look in from developers and the SEO team.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you are an organization that is struggling with Magento SEO issues, here’s what you need to learn and know about the solutions to these Magento SEO issues through our comprehensive guide.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Magento SEO issues</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Addressing issues to make the mobile-friendly website</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>While we reside in the mobile world, where site speed is the key to successful SEO, Magento is a slow platform, and has quite a shortfall. So, addressing this issue has become more critical than ever to restrict its negative impact on the performance.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Using a server with an adequate amount of RAM and configuring it rightly is the foremost step.</li><li>Choose a highly responsive design theme for web applications.</li><li>Enable Cloudflare for better site speed.</li><li>Disabling the default Magento 2 logos and enabling log cleaning features in the back end are highly helpful.&nbsp;</li><li>Go for the authentic and quality compression tools to compress images and front-end assets without compromising the quality. This enhances the image loading speed.&nbsp;</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Look for Title, Description, and Header Tags for SEO optimization</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Title tags, headings, and descriptions play a critical role in result-driving SEO. However, the default title tags and descriptions in Magento are not very SEO-friendly. To cater to this, you must be thinking of manually assigning the descriptions, heading tags, and titles, but do you think the method is viable for eCommerce product pages?&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>No, is the answer to it. So, what is the best method for it?&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A template for products using product variables. Yes, this is the best solution for addressing the less significant pages, and then you can do manual optimization of the essential pages&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For the header tags, you must follow the rules in both templates based and manual optimization. That is, make one H1 heading, two-three H2 headings, and make the rest of the titles H3 and so on.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong><strong>Eliminate duplicate content</strong></strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Magento being the dynamic e-commerce platform, generates dynamic pages that have dynamic URLs and leads to duplicate content issues. For example, while you conduct a filter search and use a different combination of searching parameters every time, the result generated will vary in different pages with dynamic URLs, but the content would be the same.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You can now address this issue of eliminating the duplicate content by making changes in the Magento backend setting. All you have to do is turn ON the canonical tag in the admin panel. All the dynamically generated pages will automatically have canonical tags pointing the duplicate content pages to the primary product pages or category pages.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Optimization of URLs for products, services, and other pages</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The dynamic URLs of e-commerce pages serve no good from the SEO perspective. Fortunately, you can address this issue by the URL rewrite features available in Magento. It automatically generates search engine friendly URLs (Search Engine Friendly URLs) for categories, products, and other content pages.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Also, you get the option of manual addition and editing of the search engine friendly URL by going to the admin panel of Magento and tweaking the settings.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Handling the two faceted navigation links</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Features like layered navigation or filter searches often lead to the creation of several SEO issues. Those significantly rising from navigation links are duplicate content, metadata, and URL.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Here we are penning down some solutions to resolve this issue:</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Try to handle site parameters and search in Google Webmaster Tools.</li><li>Incorporate the AJAX navigation as it allows the dynamic updation of page content without causing any change to the URL.&nbsp;</li><li>You need to restrict the search engine from crawling, indexing pages, and nofollow links using robots.txt provisions.&nbsp;</li><li>Using the Follow tag instead of no index, you can allow the crawling of faceted navigation and other pages, but restrict the indexing.&nbsp;</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Structure data and OOTB issues</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Structured data is the key to generating higher reviews and improving ratings on SERPs both for the products and other pages. However, Magento is based on the Out-of-Box review functionality feature that allows the tagging of structural data in the code using Schema.org coding.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is a right UX perspective that helps to spark the trust among the shoppers, but when it comes to the SEO, they can create duplicate content when it is published at more than one page.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The best solution to address this issue is having an OOTB implementation like BazaarVoice, power Reviews, etc., for these reviews.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Store sitemap issues</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You must be familiar with the importance of XML sitemap as it tells the search engines what to index or crawl and what to not. However, Magento automatically updates the XML sitemap and configures as per the needs.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This leads to inclusions of way more pages that are important, and thus all the useless pages get crawled and indexed directly affecting the rank.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>To deal with this issue, you can build a new sitemap through the configuration module of the sitemap available in the backend of Magento.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Duplicates caused by SSL</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Secure URLs are preferred nowadays by the search engines. It converts the domain URL from http:// to https:// from the entire Magento site. You can make this conversion through the “Configuration” option available under the store. Also, you need to perform the essential changes to the hosting server configuration based on the server type.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Conclusions</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>SEO is the mere path of having a sustainable and growing ecommerce business. It is essential for better ranking in SERPs to make the most of it.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, Magento SEO issues can be a hindrance in the path of accomplishing successful business. So, if you are struggling to resolve such problems and hunting for a dedicated Magento team, then you have landed at the right place.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Techies Infotech in Amritsar remains forever in your cycle of being nothing to everything. We provide several Magento services. For knowing more, you can visit our website.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
