		<title><![CDATA[Ecommerce Roadmap Ideas and Inspiration]]></title>
		<link>https://iamtechie.com/ecommerce-roadmap-ideas-and-inspiration/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 18 Jan 2022 06:35:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admins]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://iamtechie.com/?p=13996</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">In the fastest-growing eCommerce business, an </span><b>eCommerce roadmap</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> is vital to breed success.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b><i>Did you know that in 2021, eCommerce sales worldwide were $4.921 trillion? Also, the eCommerce market is likely to continue growing in the foreseeable future, with the projected worldwide sales for 2022 being 6.54 billion dollars.&nbsp;</i></b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">So to ensure that your company continues to get a piece of the ever-expanding eCommerce pie, you must create an </span><b>eCommerce website roadmap</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">. </span><b>It is a foundation to stand tall among 20 million global eCommerce websites.</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>But what exactly is an eCommerce roadmap, and how does it help in eCommerce website development?</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">An </span><b>eCommerce roadmap</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> is defined as a visual communication tool for an eCommerce organization. This roadmap aligns various marketing, design and development initiatives involved in growing your eCommerce business.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Creating an effective roadmap allows your company to clearly understand new potentials in terms of scope, size, priority and targeted customers.&nbsp;</span>

<h2 style="font-size:30px!important">How to build a successful eCommerce roadmap?</h2>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">What's more complex than building an</span><b> eCommerce website roadmap? </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">Well, it's deciding to go for your website's roadmap.</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">So if you have already decided to build a successful</span> eCommerce roadmap<span style="font-weight: 400;"> but you don't have it yet, the good news is you can do it now.</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">For an </span><b>eCommerce website development</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, you have to scratch your head, strategize day in and out to keep up with your competitor's pace. After that, you have to build a successful </span><b>eCommerce roadmap</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> that will center around your website goals and customers.</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Additionally, you have to follow a series of steps to build your </span><b>eCommerce strategy roadmap </b>so<span style="font-weight: 400;"> that you will deliver the sort of offerings that people will scoop up.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Read on to know more about how you can build a successful eCommerce website roadmap to take up on your business rivalries:&nbsp;</b></span>

<h3 style="color: #000000; font-size:22px!important">Components of a good eCommerce roadmap</h3>

<h4 style="color: #000000; font-size:18px!important">Governance</h4>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">The success of any roadmap hinges on the proper implementation of governance with the right level of support.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Corporate governance should be established early to provide a mechanism to determine priorities, make decisions and solve the issues. Additionally, it requires full team support throughout the life of the roadmap.&nbsp;</span>

<h4 style="color: #000000; font-size:18px!important">Risk management</h4>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The risk management plan is a vehicle to assess the risk that may derail your </span><b>eCommerce roadmap. </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">Risk should be thought of as the potential threats and opportunities that need to be managed for the success of your roadmap.&nbsp;</span></span>

<h4 style="color: #000000; font-size:18px!important">Change management</h4>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">No roadmap is complete without considering the importance of change management. Change management focuses on the people needed to understand and commit to the changes needed to implement the roadmap.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Successful change management aims at maximizing the success of your business at any cost.&nbsp;</span>

<h4 style="color: #000000; font-size:18px!important">Organization</h4>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">As your company moves to implement a new strategy, change to your organization may occur. This component of the eCommerce roadmap aims at adding new responsibilities for existing roles to the creation of a new organization.&nbsp;</span>

<h4 style="color: #000000; font-size:18px!important">Metrics</h4>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">A metrics-driven approach is absolutely essential to a successful roadmap.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Metrics should be tied back to your strategic goals and business results. When creating a successful roadmap, you can use these metrics. However, avoid making too many metrics. Instead, start with a few metrics and create a roadmap based on them.</span>

<h3 style="color: #000000; font-size:22px!important">Steps to create an eCommerce roadmap</h3>

<h4 style="color: #000000; font-size:18px!important">Step one: Gather insight on your target customers</h4>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>The success of an eCommerce roadmap lies in your target customers? But how well do you know your target customers?</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Most eCommerce platforms have a general idea of their customers' demographic. However, they often make the mistake of stopping there.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Hence, for customers to resonate with your brand, you should consider various aspects:</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">What challenges are my customers facing?</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Will they buy my product?</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">What motivates them to buy a product?</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">How do they interact with my site?</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">What content are they engaging with the most?</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">By answering these questions, you can get a clarity on who your ideal customers are and how you can meet their needs.</span>

<h4 style="color: #000000; font-size:18px!important">Step two: Assess where you are currently</h4>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">The content of your roadmap is generally dependent on what stage your business is at.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">If you are at an early stage, this is going to differ from a well-established business with a strong customer base. Therefore, it is for you to be realistic about where you are and where you want to go.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">For businesses starting their eCommerce journey, they have to put thoughts into selling products, competitors, wider business ambitions and the brand's journey. Therefore, forming a clear and concise business entity is the best way to start taking positive steps forward.</span>

<h4 style="color: #000000; font-size:18px!important">Step three: Future mapping</h4>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Once you have the foundation for your website, you can start to layout your plan for future growth and success. This step will forge a clear path to get from where you are to where you want to go.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>For this, you need to:</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Evaluate your current website analytics and sales number.</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Measure the results of your marketing strategy and media plans.</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Identify your business objectives and outline the budget for the rest of the year</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Fix a reasonable time for doing all the activities</span></li>
</ul>

<h4 style="color: #000000; font-size:18px!important">Step 4: Devise effective strategies</h4>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The success of any </span><b>eCommerce roadmap </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">is dependent on devising effective strategies. After doing all the framework, it's time for you to create a cohesive media plan.</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Use the information you have gathered to:</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Decide which media channels are best suited to your objective.</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Establish a content strategy to enhance your customer engagement</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Define an appropriate budget based on your business goals</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Set metrics to measure results so that you will know what's working and what's isn't.</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Devising a strategy is not enough to bring long-term gains for your business. </span><b>Big e-commerce giants like Amazon, Alibaba always stay proactive in the ever-changing digital world</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">. They keep on updating their eCommerce strategy roadmap.</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Therefore, it makes sense to keep on updating your eCommerce strategy roadmap.</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Keyways to update your eCommerce strategy roadmap</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">The trend of online shopping continues to grow, as more consumers are opting to skip the stand in line at the store. They prefer to make purchases from a socially acceptable distance via the web.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Therefore, we have outlined the various ways that you can adopt to update your </span><b>eCommerce strategy roadmap</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to meet the new online eCommerce habits of consumers.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Use data analysis to target your audience</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This may seem to you like a basic concept, but it must be added to your </span><b>eCommerce strategy roadmap</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">. With a new wave of consumers spending money online, data analysis would be of great help to see what they are buying.</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">By finding exactly who your customers are, you can look at the demographics including, how they shop and what products are selling well. This will help you make a plan around how to target your future audience.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Reframe your UX strategy with intelligent guided selling</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">In today's digitally focussed world, it is crucial to recreating the in-store experience through your online website. With the strategy of intelligent guided selling, you can offer a personalized experience to every customer and guide them through your website to the appropriate product and services.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">The mindset of consumer's convenience over everything is guiding companies to revamp their UX strategy. That is why the concept of intelligent guided selling comes to force. Through this integrated platform, a shopper can find the perfect item based on his budget, needs and mindset.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">This strategy works on the basis of asking for assistance in the store. IGS ensures that your customers easily find and configure the right products and services.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Use data effectively across all touchpoints</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">To delve a little deeper into your customer's psychology, you can use your findings across all touchpoints for precision marketing and targeted selling.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">For instance, you can segment your email market list into demographic, motivation, mindset or shopping frequency. This kind of data can give advice regarding social media marketing, which platforms to use and the type of content to share.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Hence, this sort of data analysis can give an idea about what elements need to be added to your </span><b>eCommerce roadmap strategy.&nbsp;</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Develop a strong loyalty program</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Having loyal customers is a dream for every eCommerce store!</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">An undeniable loyalty program is essential for the success of your </span><b>eCommerce roadmap</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">. When you reward customers for shopping on your online store, you invite them with the motive to keep coming back. These rewards can take the form of freebies, discounts, coupons or discounts.</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Also, increasing your customer base means achieving long-term stability for your eCommerce store.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:22px!important"><b>eCommerce roadmap ideas and inspiration</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The more you know, the more you grow. This statement makes sense when it comes to building a successful </span><b>eCommerce website roadmap.&nbsp;</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Therefore, for your help, we have compiled some of the best ecommerce roadmap examples of eCommerce best practices and innovations for your inspiration. These examples range from UX and usability to examples of functional excellence, from retailers and brands of all shapes and sizes.</span>

<h2 style="color: #000000; font-size:30px!important">Best examples of eCommerce website development roadmap:</h2>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Apple's UX design:</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Apple is an obvious example of a UX strategy done right. A company that is putting design and site design at its heart. </span><b>Apple is known to offer a 360 view option on its products.&nbsp;</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Unlike other sites, you don't need to drag the image around. Moreover, they use parallax scrolling to make the images dynamic and eliminate all the exit points so that you will get immersed in the world of Apple.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Everlane product cards and curated PLP's</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Everlane's PLP's are among the strongest templates ever designed.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">The product cards, specifically how the sizing and color options work, are very strong. Additionally, its curated groups of products (with filtering) are also very modern and well-executed.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Asos knock-out value proposition</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Asos UX design is a brilliant example of a successful roadmap. Great images, fast click, simple explainer and obvious call-to-action direct you to the men and women section.</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">One of their standout features is the video catwalk. It helps visitors to actually see what an outfit looks like. There is also an explanation video by the stylist. This gives more convenience to the customers visiting their website.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Nike's mobile usability</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Mobile usability is an under-resourced area of </span><b>eCommerce roadmaps. </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">Nike is an excellent example of a highly usable and accessible with well-optimized call-to-action, super-readable text and multiple-optimized navigation.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Everlane's contextual reviews: </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">Everlane's implementation of product reviews is a brilliant example of its site quality. Its users are able to filter for reviews on their site, which provides great context around sizing and fit.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Mansur Gavriel welcome popup:</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Mansur Gavriel is an excellent example of Shopify plus store. The site features a clean welcome popup that provides detail on local servicing. It helps users to purchase and end their purchase journey in a smooth way.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Therefore, recognizing the importance of an eCommerce roadmap, our company creates on-top digital roadmaps for the clients. We have got the chance to collaborate with some of the top eCommerce giants to build successful eCommerce websites for them.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Examples of things we have suggested to our clients recently:</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Adventure HQ: Accelerating customer engagement&nbsp;</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">For Adventure HQ, we have developed a full-service Shopify development platform. We worked towards enhancing their overall website architecture in order to generate more traffic.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Additionally, we revamped their website functionality to bring more customer engagement. Adventure HQ'S eCommerce website is an amazing example of a successful </span><b>eCommerce website roadmap.&nbsp;</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">You can also read the case study of Adventure HQ to know more about its successful </span><b>eCommerce roadmap strategy.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span>

<a style="color: #3366ff;" href="https://iamtechie.com/case-studies/adventure-hq/"><strong>Adventure HQ Case Study</strong></a>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Forever 21 : Engaging UI/UX strategies</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">To unleash endless opportunities, we offered an engaging UI/UX approach to holistic SEO strategies for Forever 21's website.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">We developed a feature-rich online platform backed by Shopify for the Forever 21 store. Also, we created a holistic roadmap to align the SEO strategies with their current brand values.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">To know more about the successful </span><b>eCommerce website roadmap</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> of Forever 21, you can read their case study on our website.&nbsp;</span></span>

<a style="color: #3366ff;" href="https://iamtechie.com/case-studies/forever21/"><strong>Forever 21 Case Study</strong></a>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:22px!important"><b>Join hands with Techies Infotech</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">At Techies Infotech, we offer the best-of-breed digital solutions to our clients. We stand tall among leading </span><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #3366ff;"><a style="color: #3366ff;" href="https://iamtechie.com/ecommerce-industry-solutions/"><strong>ecommerce website development company</strong></a></span><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;"><span style="color: #3366ff;">.</span> Our objective is to work seamlessly to make your project the best it can possibly be.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Contact us </strong><b>and get ready to dominate the digital world!</b></span>

		<title><![CDATA[GEO IP Popups for eCommerce – Best Practice UX and Strategy]]></title>
		<link>https://iamtechie.com/geo-ip-popups-for-ecommerce/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 02 Feb 2022 11:21:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admins]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://iamtechie.com/?p=14041</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b><i>Running websites in multiple markets can be a hard row to hoe. For that, GEO IP popups can come to your rescue.&nbsp;</i></b></span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><span style="font-weight: 400;">As eCommerce competition is the tightrope that every marketer has to walk with every new customer. In that case, the phrase </span><b><i>“Small things can make a big difference”</i></b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> makes a lot of sense. Especially  when it comes to creating customer’s engagement for your eCommerce website.</span></span>


<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b>GEO IP popups</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> are a vital tool in eCommerce as they are believed to<strong> i</strong></span><strong><i>ncrease the conversion rate by 44%. In fact, a case study of location data used by Factual found that more than 80% of marketers use location-based data to personalize the customer’s experience.&nbsp;</i></strong></span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Therefore, </span><b>Geo-targeted popups </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">are an ideal way to get the attention of your website visitors. But what exactly are </span><b>geo-targeted popups?</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b>Geo-targeted popups </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">are defined as modal windows on the website that will be displayed to all the users visiting your website. These modal windows display exactly like standard popup windows. Moreover, the content can change based on your visitors IP or geolocation.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000; font-size:16px!important">Though, we all are accustomed to generic popups that encourage us to give our relevant information when we try to visit a website. Geo popups are a step ahead of generic popups.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><span style="font-weight: 400;">They add trust and relevancy factors to the popup with a view to increasing the conversion rates. By displaying </span><b>a geolocation popup</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to your customer, you are monopolizing their attention for a brief moment and increasing the odds that they will engage in the behavior you want them to.&nbsp;</span></span>
<h2 style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>How do geo-targeted popups work for your eCommerce website?</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">:</span></span></h2>
<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Geo-targeted popups</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> work in the same way as other geo-targeted elements on your website work. In these popups, users are identified based on your GEO IP. Based on that location data, you can easily identify their location.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important""><span style="font-weight: 400;">Though the popup itself is a simple HTML snippet, you can include it on your website with ease. All you need to do is establish your </span><b>geo-targeted popups.&nbsp;</b></span>
<h3 style="font-size: 20px;"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>Creating Geo-targeted popups - step by step guide</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">:</span></span></h3>

<ul>
<li aria-level="1"><span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b>Set up your website</b></span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b>Create an ideal popup design</b></span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b>Preview your popup</b></span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b>Add geolocation popup</b></span></li>
 	<li aria-level="1"><span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b>Add cookie expiry</b></span></li>
 	<li aria-level="1"><span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b>Add snippet code to your website</b></span></li>
</ul>
<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important">Therefore, adding </span><b>geo-targeted popups</b><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important"> to your website is a great way to encourage engagement for your users.</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important">However, it is essential to use </span><b>eCommerce popups </b><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important">on your website without ruining the user’s experience. This is when the scene of building a successful UX strategy for </span><b>Geo-targeted popups</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> comes in the scene.</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important">The purpose of using </span><b>GEO targeted popups</b><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important"> is to get more engagement without ruining users’ experience on the website. Moreover, a well-thought-out UX design using popups can improve your user experience. But how?&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b>For that, you need to implement the best UX strategies to make your popups more user-friendly.</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:16px!important"><b>Building a successful UX strategy with Geo-targeted popups</b></span>


<h3 style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: #000000; style="font-size: 20px;""><b>Display popups based on engagement&nbsp;</b><span style="font-weight: 400; style="font-size: 22px;"">:</span></span></h3>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Let’s agree, there is nothing more annoying than the traditional entry popups!&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">These popups appear immediately when you open a website. These popups are frustrating as they contain a lot of frustrating advertisements.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:22px!important"><b>Entry popups disturb you in a way as:</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000; font-size:16px!important">They interrupt the typical browsing and reading flow</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000; font-size:16px!important">prevent visitors from getting access to the desired content</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000; font-size:16px!important">often contain irrelevant or outdated content</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000; font-size:16px!important">make s visitors lost&nbsp;</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000; font-size:16px!important">Ultimately, they can really improve the user experience on your site. But the question arises how you can make your popups less disturbing and more interactive?</span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:22px!important"><b>Here are some typical solutions that you can follow to make your popups more engaging and more user-friendly:</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000; font-size:16px!important">Display the after popup after every [x] second</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000; font-size:16px!important">Show the popup only after the visitor has scrolled down your page</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; font-size:16px!important" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000; font-size:16px!important">Display your popup on exit-intent content to avoid your visitors from abandoning.</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">In this way, you can make your users more engaging without disturbing them. Most of the big giants are already using this technique to avoid entry-level popups.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>For example, Google has created webmaster guidelines to avoid the use of entry-level popups.&nbsp;</b></span>


<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Creating segments for your visitors&nbsp;</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Your popup can only be useful and loveable for your visitors if it provides a solution to their problems. The best strategy that has currently been used is displaying</span><b> geo popups </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">on the basis of segmentation.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Segmenting means determining some groups of visitors that contain people with similar needs and characteristics. All eCommerce websites can segment their visitors into varied groups based on their interests and the stage of their buying process.</span>


<span style="color: #000000;"><b>To work out your visitor segments, try to think like your customers and ask questions including;</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"></span></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Who are they</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">What do they want?&nbsp;</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">When do they want that?</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">&nbsp;Are they ready to buy?</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Once you’ve separated your visitors based on their interests, demographic or geographic variables, you can show them the most appropriate message through your popups.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">You can use the following segmentation options to engage more customers on your website:\</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Returning visitors: </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">The returning visitors are more engaged visitors who are closer to buying from your website than new visitors who are learning about your website for the first time.</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Cold vs hot prospects:</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> You should create different conversion goals for hot or cold prospects. For hot prospects, the conversion goal should be to engage customers for immediate purchase.</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">However, for cold prospects, you need a secondary conversion goal to make them subscribe.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">After getting their contact details, you can communicate with them in the future.&nbsp;</span>


<span style="color: #000000;"><b>For example, BOOM! Started a campaign that engages visitors with specific messages relevant to them. They offer an ebook as a lead magnet for early-stage visitors who are interested in a product range. Though they are not ready to purchase immediately, they can buy your product in the future.</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This shows how wonderfully their UI/UX strategy works as a part of engaging more customers through </span><b>eCommerce popups.</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Target visitors based on the buying process</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">In a typical</span><b> “ sales funnel” process</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, your first goal is to get the visitors into the funnel. This is called awareness.&nbsp;</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Additionally, you need to guide them through the subsequent processes of interest, consideration, intent and evaluation before actually arriving at the buying process.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Though, it is not practical to communicate the same message to all the customers as every customer is in a different stage. Some are early stage customers who are just engaging with your website. While others are middle-stage customers who are more engaged visitors. There are also late-stage visitors who have more chances of buying your products than any other stage customers.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Hence, you can make your eCommerce popup strategy depending on the stage of your customer:</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>For early-stage customers</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, you can use blog posts, social media updates, infographics or podcasts.</span></span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>For middle-stage customers</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, you can use educational or useful resources, webinars, quizzes or surveys to communicate your information to the buyers.</span></span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>To engage late-stage customers</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, you can offer discounts, coupons or packaged deals.</span></span></li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Additionally, you also need to engage their onsite behaviour if you really want to communicate relevant offers to them. For that, you can control who can see your popups. For example;</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Visitors who have been on your subpage for at least “ x” seconds</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Opened at least “x” number of pages</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Are you browsing one of these pages</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Have spent at least “x” seconds browsing your website</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">This can allow you to display different popups based on your customer’s behaviour.</span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size: 20px!important"><b>Avoid the one-size-fits-all approach</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The phrase,</span><b>” if you are selling to everyone, you are selling to no one”</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, fits perfectly in the case of </span><b>eCommerce popups.</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">&nbsp;Your visitors have different interests, concerns and purchasing goals. So why treat them all the same? You can show the most appropriate message to your visitors after separating them on the basis of interests, demographic or geographic variables.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">With a dynamic text approach, the text in your popup will update based on the variable you choose. The dynamical altering text allows you to gather leads more effectively as it can display highly targeted messages to different visitor groups.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">In this way, you can engage more visitors to your website with the help of geo-targeted popups.</span>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:20px!important"><b>Stay focussed on one value proposition</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">.</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Through a value proposition, you can convince your customers that they will benefit from your product.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">To maximize your conversion with onsite retargeting, you should limit yourself to one value proposition or goal per popup. Also, make sure to highlight it. Moreover, if you are trying to achieve multiple goals with your popups, it would be complex.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">As convincing your visitors to take different actions, can delay decision-making and can make your popups look more confusing.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Therefore, it is vital to clearly display your messages in the popup and not use any distracting graphics that make it hard for the visitors to read the text. Here are some possible goals and how you should focus the value propositions or messages in your popups to achieve them:</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Driving sales:</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Offers discounts and coupons</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Promote special offer</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Offer a save cart option</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Building your email list:</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Highlight your newsletter subscription</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Promote VIP Membership</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Offer email-only deals</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Offer free gateways and product samples</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Upselling and cross-selling:</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Upsell features and services</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Upsell and cross-sell products</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Cross-sell products dynamically</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="color: #000000;"><b>For example, Unbounce is a clear example of popups used right. It doesn’t use any waffles on its homepage. Instead, its marketers focus on a clear, concise message that lets you know exactly what the company is selling.</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">This simple marketing is backed up with testimonials, social proof, and plenty of visuals to explain how Unbounce can help eCommerce businesses improve their website.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>Don’t ask for too much information</b></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The success of </span><b>GEO targeted popups</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> mainly lie in providing value to the prospects. When you ask your visitors to sign up for your newsletter, you should also give them a special reward for subscribing.</span></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">However, it doesn’t matter how valuable your giveaways are; no one will sign-up if you ask for too much information. Additionally, new visitors may also be hesitant to provide too much information about themselves.&nbsp;</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">So you should follow the rule of </span><b>“ less is more”.</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> The less data you request, the more conversions you will get. The less is more approach is used by many eCommerce giants as a part of the UX eCommerce popup strategy.</span></span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><b>For example, Hulala</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> doesn’t ask for much of your personal information when you visit their website. To be able to personalize your messages in the future, they will only ask for your first name and your email address.</span></span>
<h2 style="font-size: 20px;"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>General recommendations for GEO IP popups?</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">:</span></span></h2>
<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Here are a few other recommendations for making your </span><b>GEO IP popups</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> more friendly:</span></span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Make sure your </span><b>GEO IP popups </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">are the first thing that loads on your page. The popup on your website should appear as fast as possible.</span></span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Make sure you track views of your popups and clicks. For that, you can use google analytics to track views and click on the popups so that you will have more visibility of issues around traffic handling.</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Track impact on conversion rates.</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Be proactive in suggesting the country. This will help improve the performance of the overall overlay.</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Highlight the shipping, language or currency on store options</span></li>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">Have a clear close button but darken the background and make primary store recommendations more clear and bold to increase usage.</span></li>
</ul>

<span style="color: #000000; font-size:20px!important"><b>Techies Infotech: Best eCommerce Development Company</b></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="color: #000000;">Techies Infotech is your one-stop destination for all eCommerce solutions. We quantify our strategies to match up your business needs. We are among the</span> </span><b><a href="https://iamtechie.com/ecommerce-industry-solutions/">best eCommerce development companies</a> </b><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000000;">as we offer the best off-bread solution to our clients.</span>

<a href="https://iamtechie.com/contact-us/"><strong>Contact us today!</strong></a>]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[How the Metaverse will Transform eCommerce Future?]]></title>
		<link>https://iamtechie.com/how-the-metaverse-will-transform-ecommerce-future/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 14 Feb 2022 06:46:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admins]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://iamtechie.com/?p=14059</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><strong><em>Hope that within the next decade, the metaverse will reach a billion people, host hundreds of billions of dollars of digital commerce, and support jobs for millions of creators and developers”.</em></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><strong><em>                                                                                             Mark Zuckerberg</em></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Even though Facebook isn't the first company to announce a metaverse, the announcement raises an important question about the future of the internet; how will e-commerce be carried out in the metaverse?</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">The metaverse will make purchasing for consumers a significantly more straightforward process, according to tech futurist<strong> Cathy Hackle. </strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">According to Hackle, virtual reality purchasing can be entailed as, “Imagine yourself walking down the street. Suddenly, a product pops into your head. Next to you appears a vending machine full of the product and variations you were considering. You stop, pick an item from the vending machine, it is shipped to your house, and you continue on your way."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Metaverse, or the Spatial Web/Web 3.0, is poised to eliminate the current boundary between digital and physical content. Despite appearing like science fiction, the technologies that underpin this paradigm shift are already commonplace. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><strong><em>So, could the metaverse take the place of the internet as we know it? If so, what impact would that have on online-only spaces like eCommerce?</em></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><strong><em>This article will explore some of the ways eCommerce is leveraging the principles of virtual connectivity in the newly minted metaverse.</em></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<h2 style="font-size: 30px;"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>METAVERSE: What exactly is it?</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">:</span></span></h2>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Consumers and brands have trouble grasping the concept of the metaverse. Metaverses do not yet exist, at least not in the sense that people like Mark Zuckerberg envision. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Like many emerging technologies, the notion of the metaverse has no universal definition.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">As opposed to being a single innovation, the metaverse is an extension of several technologies that have been readily adopted by consumers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><strong><em>It's the convergence of these innovations - AR, VR, blockchain, cryptocurrency, social commerce, just to name a few - that creates a network of virtual spaces interacting in real-time, which serve not only as new channels for selling but also as a form of e-commerce.</em></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">With technology such as 3D, AR, VR, AI, and 5G, a digital twin of the real world will be created, fully rendered in life-like virtual environments.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">This makes it possible for every object, store, conversation, image, and even space itself to seamlessly integrate into the metaverse, where it can be enhanced through 3D or augmented reality, or explored and personalized.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><strong><em>Brands can use the metaverse not just to replicate what exists in the physical world but to address newfound needs and challenges that are unique to digital spaces.</em></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2 style="font-size: 30px; color: #000!important;"><strong>What makes up the metaverse?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3 style="font-size: 22px; color: #000!important;"><strong>Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">6 out of 10 consumers say they prefer making purchases from sites that incorporate Augmented Reality (AR). Despite its sci-fi image, AR/VR is already integrated into consumer behavior.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Due to their many uses across the shopping experience, AR and VR are becoming increasingly important to merchants who sell products that are traditionally difficult to buy online. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><strong><em>Amazon's marketplace features early metaverse technology</em></strong><strong>.</strong> Room Decorator, its newest AR shopping tool, lets you view how furniture, walls, and other home décor will look in your space using your smartphone or tablet. Multiple products can be viewed together, and even an AR snapshot of your room can be saved for later use.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Consumers can make better-informed buying decisions with the assistance of AR's product visualization capabilities.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="font-size: 22px; color: #000!important;"><strong>NFTs</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">The fact that the Collins Dictionary chose Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) as the word of the year for 2021 seems hardly surprising because of the hype surrounding this technology. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Fashion has become a blockchain-based digital asset, as have memes and popular collectibles, and there is so much more to come.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Blockchain helps to assure authenticity, verifiability, and exclusive ownership of all digital assets, including art, clothing, <strong>a LeBron James </strong>photo, and even experiences themselves. As a result, NFTs are indeed unique and limited assets, and therefore can hold value.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Despite the complexity of NFTs, it is their foolproof method of authentication that makes them a core building block of the metaverse. Besides facilitating transactions, NFTs are capable of creating new digital goods that enhance value propositions for both brands and consumers alike.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3 style="font-size: 22px; color: #000!important;"><strong>Gamification</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Virtual environments, such as those found in video games, are normally the first thing that comes to mind when we think of immersive digital environments. Consumers are drawn to gamification because it blends risk with reward. Risks and rewards grow as we move forward.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><strong><em>In addition, Roblox is on track to become a leading player in the transition to the metaverse.</em></strong> Among the platforms that contain a variety of online worlds, Roblox is probably the best example.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Avatars can be customized across all Roblox games, and players can accessorize them as well.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;">Custom accessories have already spawned an in-game economy. <strong><em>As part of its collaboration with Gucci, Roblox recently hosted a virtual in-game experience. </em></strong>Several Gucci branded items were available in-game, with one virtual Gucci handbag even selling for $4,115.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<h3 style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>eCommerce in the Metaverse</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">:</span></span></h3>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">In his own words, Zuckerberg has made it explicit that the digital revolution will revolve around shopping and commerce.</span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><b><i>The metaverse will remove many of the physical constraints we see on commerce today and make entirely new businesses possible’</i></b></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><b><i>                                                                                Vishal Shah, Meta’s VP</i></b></p>

<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">As the paradigm shift is so huge, it can be difficult to imagine its implications and applications in the real world. However, they are already happening. Furniture and other products are being visualized in consumers' homes as part of the purchase process. Retailers can offer their customers a more engaging sales experience and consumers can customize their purchases before making a purchase with three-dimensional models. </span></p>

<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Each side is already reaping the benefits. When it comes to making purchases online, consumers care about convenience, confidence, and control. Similarly, retailers are seeing considerable returns on their investments, as well as cost savings and sustainability benefits.</span></p>

<p style="font-size: 22px; color: #000!important;"><b>Enhancing Personalization</b></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Through the metaverse, eCommerce businesses will be able to personalize their offerings for consumers. </span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><b><i>Couldn't it be wonderful if all of your customers were invited to the launch of your new line? </i></b></p>

<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The digital advantage of the metaverse will make all this possible.</span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Payment services are anticipating a huge benefit from the metaverse because people won't be paying cash in a digital world.</span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">In only a few moments, you can discover, personalize, and buy products from the comfort of your home. With the metaverse, eCommerce companies will be able to offer their customers more without having to charge them more.</span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The metaverse may also provide users with tools for creating their own virtual stores and earning commission on physical products they are selling. Metaverse will offer new opportunities for entrepreneurship and represent the next step in e-commerce and retail, according to </span><b>TCI entertainment.</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> </span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">A digital franchise of a real-world retailer has also been proposed as a possibility for those using the metaverse. Virtual shelves can be stocked with products that users may be interested in buying.</span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><b>Kevin Indig, Director of Shopify</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, a multinational e-commerce platform, believes the metaverse will help decentralize e-commerce. The decentralized e-commerce model breaks away from uniform marketplace formats, allowing brands to virtualize the shopping experience, further paralleling in-store and home shopping. </span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The corporate world has already begun to realize these opportunities. </span><b>Mastercard estimates </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">that the global augmented and mixed reality market will grow 54% over the next decade, reaching $372 billion by 2026. </span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">As purchasing becomes an even more accessible process for consumers, we may soon see the emergence of new forms of e-commerce that are mainstream.</span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Using </span><b>Ikea's Studio app,</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> customers can create their own spaces using augmented reality technology. There is an entire line of virtual cosmetics from </span><b>L'Oréal. </b></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Additionally,</span><b> Gucci </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">has launched its </span><b>Gucci Virtual 25 sneakers</b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, designed by designer Alessandro Michele, for $12.99 per pair.</span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Each of these is a small step in the direction of the Metaverse regardless of the limitations of the technology and protocols we use today. It will take time and incremental growth to bring about a tipping point, much as the internet did.</span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Is the metaverse headed for a bright future? In the metaverse, we are uncertain whether we can ever physically 'walk' in and be present in a different world. </span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Companies like Meta must build out the architecture for creating an open-source standard if they are going to contribute to the development of the metaverse.</span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">In fact, smart brands will begin buying virtual real estate and procuring builders to build their brand presence and experiences in virtual worlds, where they will sell both digital and physical products to consumers who split their time between multiple worlds. </span></p>
<p style="color: #000!important; font-size: 16px!important;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">The legacy internet will turn into a ghetto for lagged brands and organizations in the real world.</span></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Critical Mistakes To Avoid When Starting Your First eCommerce Business!]]></title>
		<link>https://iamtechie.com/critical-mistakes-to-avoid-when-starting-your-first-ecommerce-business/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 03 Mar 2022 09:19:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admins]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://iamtechie.com/?p=14246</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">The eCommerce industry is competitive because all sellers register on the Internet and provide their products to potential customers. Although making millions will help you, there is more to it than registering a store and providing your products to potential customers.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Unfortunately, some previous sellers have failed to make enough sales because they neglected the aspects of online marketing. So, you shouldn't make the same mistakes they did if you don't want to fail like them.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Thus, you must learn how to avoid some common </span><b style="color: #000;">eCommerce mistakes</b><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;"> so that your store will succeed and offer customers a great experience.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Here are the top issues that you should avoid when setting up an e-commerce store.</span>

<i><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Let's get to it!</span></i>
<h2 style="font-size: 30px!important;"><b>Top critical mistakes to avoid when setting up an e-commerce store</b></h2>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Owners of businesses should ensure that their websites are more than "just online stores"; rather, they should provide their customers with an amazing experience. Let's look at why avoiding mistakes is so important.</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 20px!important;" aria-level="1">
<h4>Choosing the Wrong eCommerce Platform</h4>
</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">The way your eCommerce platform is designed can decide whether your business succeeds or fails. This is true whether you are just starting or operating for a while.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Apart from displaying products and selling to customers, eCommerce platforms also attract new users and scale your business.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Thus, while choosing an eCommerce platform, you'll have to keep in mind a variety of factors, like:</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">❖</span> <span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Products that you are thinking of offering.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">❖</span> <span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">How are you planning to expand your business?</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">❖</span> <span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">In what way would you like to have control over your website?</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">❖</span> <span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Tools required for integrating your platform.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">❖</span> <span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">The most important question is: what is your budget?</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">❖</span> <span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Depending on your needs, you can choose a templated design or ask for it to be customized.</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 20px!important;" aria-level="1">
<h4>Invest in a reliable eCommerce platform.</h4>
</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">If you choose a platform that does not integrate with your existing systems, limits your business growth, and does not enable you to customize and control your system effectively it can create an unwanted hurdle for your business to grow.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Choosing the wrong eCommerce platforms can cause various issues, such as revenue loss, lower conversions, reduced traffic, security risks, poor design, and so on.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">So, it is better to take your time when choosing the right eCommerce platform for your online business, but be sure to select the right one. If you have any concerns, it's better to hire an eCommerce website development company that can serve you in the best possible manner.</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 20px!important;">
<h4>Poor Store Navigation</h4>
</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Poor store navigation is the biggest deterrent to a customer making a purchase. </span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Imagine if you had to dig around for the right information or buttons, or if you had to pick from lots of font types or colors, you would certainly be disappointed.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">So it is extremely important to have an easy-to-navigate eCommerce website.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Visitors to your online store need to navigate product images, descriptions, and checkout procedures quickly. They must also return to the home page by clicking the header.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Fortunately, there are not many complications involved to get an online store up and running smoothly. If you want to improve the efficiency of your eCommerce site, you can hire experts who offer </span><a href="https://iamtechie.com/service/web-development/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">web development services</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000;"> for eCommerce.</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 20px!important;">
<h4>Inadequate Product Images</h4>
</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">The most common eCommerce mistake made by business owners is uploading the wrong product images, followed by store navigation.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">It seems they're eager to get their store online as quickly as possible and later regret their decision when no sales are happening, even though visitors are coming through.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">The problem is inadequate product images, as many of you probably guessed.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">As you can see, product images are an excellent alternative to the product description for potential customers to get the most out of their purchase, especially if they cannot see or test the item in person.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">It is therefore advisable to upload images that are taken from different viewpoints.</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 20px!important;">
<h4>Not Paying Enough Attention To Customer Service</h4>
</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Whatever your business model is, how you treat your customers matters, even if you don't know them personally.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">It's important to ask yourself, "How do you answer your customers' questions? Do you assist them when they ask? How do you solve their problems?"</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">As long as you keep that in mind, you're likely to have a good experience with them. However, if you do not consider customer service or answer their questions, you may end up in big trouble!</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 20px!important;">
<h4>Not Analyzing The Competitors</h4>
</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">No matter how skillful you are, if you are lacking behind your competitors, you have a lot to learn to succeed in the eCommerce business.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Learning about your competitors and their tactics is the key to defeating them. Don't worry; it isn't illegal to know your competitor’s success secrets!</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Although it may seem unethical, you should base your products and pricing decisions on your competitors' actions.</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 20px!important;">
<h4>Not Following The Trends</h4>
</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">None of the customers will purchase a product that is out of trend. Unfortunately, most eCommerce store owners list products in-store without checking the latest trends and later regret if they don't get sales. </span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">So keep up with the latest trends, folks! It's important if you want to get ahead.</span><span style="font-weight: 400;">
</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 20px!important;">
<h4>Complicated Checkout Process</h4>
</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">When the user has completed the initial steps of the sales process, they can move on to the checkout process.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Checkout is confusing for many reasons - mainly because it is too complicated.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Fumbling through the checkout process will only cause your customers to give up and disappear before they even make a purchase.</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 20px!important;">
<h4>Failure To Identify The Right Audience</h4>
</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">If you don't know your target audience, how will you know who they are? No matter how beautiful or amazing your products are, it doesn't matter if you have customers.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Your business can be a success if you memorize one phrase - "Customer satisfaction is always paramount."</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Whether you plan or execute, you should always consider the customer's needs.</span>
<h2 style="font-size: 30px!important;">Techies Infotech: eCommerce Website Development Company</h2>
<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Every business owner wishes they'd known something when they first got started. Luckily, a smart eCommerce website developer would not repeat past mistakes and mourn them forever. </span>

<span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;">Techies Infotech is a reliable </span><a href="https://iamtechie.com/ecommerce-industry-solutions/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">eCommerce website development company</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400; color: #000; font-size: 16px;"> that helps clients fulfill all their eCommerce needs without hassle.</span>

<a href="https://iamtechie.com/contact-us/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Contact us Now</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">!</span>]]></content:encoded>
